page.title: 10Geographical
page.content: Our village is called Tai'rgwaith, which means 'Three Works'. The village is divided into two separate areas. The houses in the lower part of the village are mainly stone built private houses. This is also where the village school is, the only shop and the Baker's Arms-a pub, can also be found here.Tai'rgwaith has three sreets of red bricked terraced houses which were once owned by local mining companies. Then they were owned by the NCB, butmany of the people have bought their own. There are also council houses, sheltered housing for the old people,a working men's social club, a church, a community hall,and a children's park.There are also a few private houses. The village is a cul-de-sac, bordered to the north and east by open cast mining.To the west there is farmland and to the south....
